title: Algebra Problem-Solving Strategies Using Imitation Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic algebraic concepts (equations, linear functions, etc.) and experience in solving simple problems
context.additional_context: Aims to improve foundational numeracy skills required in social sector roles (e.g., data analysis, policy planning).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze given algebraic problem-solving cases and explain core solution steps with over 80% accuracy
Learners can independently solve close variant problems with over 70% accuracy through imitation learning
Learners can apply adaptive strategies (variable modification, step reorganization, etc.) for solving distant variant problems with over 60% accuracy

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
